citations.narrative:
The wallabies are currently housed outdoors in a yard surrounded by a single six foot high fence. They are not
surrounded by a secondary or perimeter fence. A perimeter fence is required to keep out other animals and unauthorized
persons and to act as a secondary containment system. The wallabies must be housed in an enclosure surrounded by a
perimeter fence that is at least six feet high and three feet from the perimeter fence. Correct by May 22, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The wallabies are currently housed outdoors in a yard surrounded by a single six foot high fence. They are not 
surrounded by a secondary or perimeter fence. A perimeter fence is required to keep out other animals and unauthorized 
persons and to act as a secondary containment system. The wallabies must be housed in an enclosure surrounded by a 
perimeter fence that is at least six feet high and three feet from the perimeter fence. Correct by May 22, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
